1.text: My son, forget not my law; but let thy heart keep my commandments;

2.text: For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.

3.text: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thy heart:

4.text: So shalt thou find favor and good understanding in the sight of God and man.

5.text: Trust in the LORD with all thy heart; and lean not to thy own understanding.

6.text: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he will direct thy paths.

7.text: Be not wise in thy own eyes: fear the LORD, and depart from evil.

8.text: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.

9.text: Honor the LORD with thy substance, and with the first-fruits of all thy increase:

10.text: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.

11.text: My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD; neither be weary of his correction:

12.text: For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.

13.text: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.

14.text: For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain of it than fine gold.

15.text: She is more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared to her.

16.text: Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honor.

17.text: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.

18.text: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retaineth her.

19.text: The LORD by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.

20.text: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.

21.text: My son, let not them depart from thy eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:

22.text: So shall they be life to thy soul, and grace to thy neck.

23.text: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.

24.text: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: but thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.

25.text: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.

26.text: For the LORD will be thy confidence, and will keep thy foot from being taken.

27.text: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thy hand to do it.

28.text: Say not to thy neighbor, Go, and come again, and to-morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.

29.text: Devise not evil against thy neighbor, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.

30.text: Strive not with a man without cause, if he hath done thee no harm.

31.text: Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.

32.text: For the froward is abomination to the LORD: but his secret is with the righteous.

33.text: The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just.

34.text: Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace to the lowly.

35.text: The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.
